Revelations: GCHQ's cable-tapping Tempora operation
Type of collaboration: The GCHQ provided the NSA access to data collected by tapping 200 fibre optic cables

Revelations: Large scale NSA activity in Germany, with domestic cooperation
Type of collaboration: Unpublished documents suggest that the BND collaborated with the NSA

Revelations: NSA works with the German BND
Type of collaboration: The NSA provided the BND access to Xkeyscore and they both jointly operated a data collection site in Bavaria called Bad Aibling

Revelations: NSA pays GCHQ for access to intelligence
Type of collaboration: The NSA paid the GCHQ more than $100 million for access to its intelligence operations, as well as $1.5 million to redevelop a site in the UK which intercepts communications from transatlantic cables

Revelations: NSA shares raw intelligence with Israel
Type of collaboration: The NSA shared raw signals intelligence data with Israel's ISNU through a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)
Target of collaboration: Public and potentially judges and lawmakers as well

Revelations: NSA and GCHQ target Tor anonymity software
Type of collaboration: The NSA and GCHQ collaborated in attempting to compromise the Tor anonymity network

Revelations: US and Canada spy on Brazil's Ministry of Mines and Energy
Type of collaboration: The phone and computer communications of the Brazilian Ministry of Mines and Energy was shared between the NSA and Canada's CSEC
Target of collaboration: Brazilian Ministry of Mines and Energy

Revelations: NSA and GCHQ break into Yahoo and Google data centres
Type of collaboration: The NSA and GCHQ collaborated in breaking into Google and Yahoo data centres.

Revelations: European collaboration with NSA and GCHQ
Intelligence agencies: NSA, GCHQ, Intelligence services in Europe and Asia
Countries: EU, Japan, South Korea, France, Germany, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden
Type of collaboration: 18 European countries, Japan and South Korea have a “focused cooperation” relationship with the NSA that allows access to their citizens' metadata. The GCHQ has collaborated with intelligence services in France, Germany, Holland, Italy, Spain and Sweden to develop technical capabilities and to weaken domestic legal protections.

Revelations: Canada allowed NSA to spy on G8 and G20 Summits
Type of collaboration: Canada's CSEC coordinated with the NSA to spy on the G8 and G20 summits in Toronto.
Target of collaboration: Political leaders participating at the G8 and G20 summits in Toronto

Revelations: Australia offered to share citizens' data with the NSA
Type of collaboration: Australia's ASD offered to share its own citizens' unredacted metadata with the NSA “as long as there is no intent to target an Australian national”.

Revelations: Sweden's close relationship with the NSA, GCHQ
Type of collaboration: Sweden's FRA had a close relationship with the NSA and GCHQ. The FRA has provided the NSA access to information intercepted from Swedish telecoms cables since 2011.
Target of collaboration: Citizens in the Baltic region and the Russian energy industry

Revelations: Online games infiltrated by NSA and GCHQ
Type of collaboration: The NSA and GCHQ collaborated in infiltrating in-game communications in World of Warcraft and Xbox Live.
Target of collaboration: The in-game communications of online gamers.

Revelations: Extent of Canadian cooperation with the NSA revealed
Type of collaboration: Canada's CSEC set up and operated covert spying posts in 20 countries at the behest of the NSA, personnel from the CSEC are stationed at an NSA facility and a reciprocal staffing arrangement exists.

Revelations: NSA and GCHQ use Google tracking cookies to identify targets
Type of collaboration: The NSA and GCHQ identified targets through the use of Google tracking cookies for “remote exploitation” and then shared information with their Five Eyes partners

Revelations: Sweden's FRA engages in offensive operations, has access to XKeyScore
Type of collaboration: The NSA provided Sweden's FRA with access to the XkeyScore tool. These two intelligence agencies also collaborated in offensive operations against five machines.
Target of collaboration: Public, The machines of unknown targets

Revelations: Norway's 61 year relationship with the NSA
Type of collaboration: Norway's NIS is one of the NSA's two main foreign partners in the field of technical signals intelligence. The two agencies have collaborated since 1954 and their collaboration has included intelligence gathering on Russian civilians.

Revelations: 200 million text messages a day collected and analysed
Type of collaboration: The NSA provided the GCHQ access to millions of text messages it collected and analysed

Revelations: ASD violates legal privilege and shares data with NSA
Type of collaboration: Australia's ASD shared information with the NSA that targeted a law firm advising the government of Indonesia in trade talks.

Revelations: Dutch interception of Somali phone data likely supports US drone strikes
Type of collaboration: Dutch interception of Somali phone data likely supports US drone strikes
Target of collaboration: Suspected terrorists and civilians in Somalia

Revelations: NSA's partnership arrangements obscure to elected politicians
Type of collaboration: The NSA has “Third Party Relationships” with multiple intelligence agencies from countries outside of the anglophone Five Eyes alliance, which are maintained regardless of elected politicians in those countries.

Revelations: Norway acquires a supercomputer for cryptanalysis
Type of collaboration: Norway's intelligence service collaborates with the NSA in the field of cryptanalysis

Revelations: GCHQ sought “unsupervised access” to PRISM data
Type of collaboration: The NSA provided the GCHQ access to data collected through PRISM and other tools

Revelations: “Collect it all” is an explicit Five Eyes goal
Intelligence agencies: NSA, GCHQ, ASD, CSEC, GCSB (Five Eyes)
Type of collaboration: The Five Eyes collaborate on collecting and analysing data.

Revelations: GCHQ and NSA aim for global coverage of in-flight phone data
Type of collaboration: The NSA planned to collect global in-flight communications data and to share it with Five Eyes partners

Revelations: GCHQ's Oman base and the corporate partners behind Tempora
Type of collaboration: The GCHQ has a number of bases in Oman which tap directly into 9 undersea cables. Such data was subsequently shared with the NSA.

Revelations: Data used to kill terrorist suspects is intercepted in Germany
Type of collaboration: Germany provided intelligence to the NSA which was used to “arrest or kill more than 40 terrorists”

Revelations: BND works together with NSA on Special Source Operations
Type of collaboration: The NSA and BND collaborate on the Special Source Operations. The NSA has provided the BND access to XkeyScore and the two agencies jointly had staffed projects at Germany's Bad Aibling base.

Revelations: Third party countries allow NSA access to internet backbone
Intelligence agencies: NSA, Intelligence agencies from “third party countries”
Countries: US, UK, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, Algeria, Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ethiopia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, India, Israel, Italy, Japan, Jordan, Korea, Macedonia, Netherlands, Norway, Pakistan, Poland, Romania, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, Thailand, Tunisia, Turkey, UAE
Type of collaboration: The NSA's “unconventional special access program” relies on third party countries (rather that on the Five Eyes) which provide it direct access to fibre optic cables.

Revelations: NSA advising Saudi Arabia on “internal security”
Type of collaboration: The NSA “had an interest in Saudi Arabia's regime continuity” and provided Saudi Arabia's Ministry of Interior technical assistance and training.

Revelations: NSA supports Israeli surveillance of Palestinians
Type of collaboration: The NSA supported Israel's ISNU with intelligence on Palestinians. Much of the NSA's intelligence was gathered from Jordan's Electronic Warfare Directorate and from the Palestinian Authority Security Forces.

Revelations: Five Eyes port scanning entire countries
Type of collaboration: The Five Eyes share information between them which they collect by scanning entire countries for vulnerable computer systems.
Target of collaboration: Administrative and public facing services around the world.

Revelations: NSA aids Turkey in lethal operations against Kurdish separatists
Type of collaboration: The NSA provided intelligence to Turkey in its operations against Kurdish separatists.
Target of collaboration: Kurdish separatists, PKK leaders inside and outside Turkey.

Revelations: NSA and GCHQ targeted SIM card manufacturer and seized encryption keys
Type of collaboration: The NSA-GCHQ joint unit called the Mobile Handset Exploitation Team broke into the internal network of Gemalto, the world's largest SIM card manufacturer
Target of collaboration: Public, Employees of major telecoms networks

Revelations: New Zealand spying on its neighbourhood for the Five Eyes
Type of collaboration: New Zealand's GCSB shared Asia-Pacific communications it collected with its Five Eyes partners, by making them available through Xkeyscore.

Revelations: Inside Ironsand: New Zealand's Five Eyes spy base
Type of collaboration: New Zealand's satellite interception station (codenamed IRONSAND) is linked into the Five Eyes network.

Revelations: New Zealand spies on – and with – Bangladesh
Type of collaboration: New Zeland's GCSB shared intelligence data with Bangladeshi authorities who have been implicated in torture and politically motivated killings.

Revelations: New Zealand's spies plotted China hack with the NSA
Type of collaboration: The GCSB planned to tap a Chinese diplomatic data connection in New Zealand to gain access to China's computer systems, which would have aided the NSA's intelligence gathering if it was infact carried out.
Target of collaboration: Chinese diplomatic data connection in New Zealand

Revelations: Spy agencies planned to implant spyware on phones using app stores
Type of collaboration: A joint Five Eyes unit planned to infect smartphones with spyware by exploiting mobile phone browsers and data links to Google and Samsung app stores

Revelations: Sweden's FRA spies on Russian leadership for the NSA
Type of collaboration: Sweden's FRA was one of the NSA's “primary partners” in obtaining information on Russian targets.
